sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
What number should be added to each of the numbers \(7 \), \(12 \), \(22 \), and \(32 \) to make them proportional.
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "Lets suppose that the required number is $z $.

Since the numbers $7 + z $, $12 + z $, $22 + z $, $32 + z $ are in proportion, we have
\[
	\frac{\input[s1v1]{} + z }{12 + z } = \frac{\input[s1v2]{} + z }{32 + z }
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow (7 + z )(32 + z ) = (12 + z )(22 + z )
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow 224 + z (\input[s2v1]{} ) + z ^2 = 264 + z (\input[s2v2]{} ) + z ^2
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow z (39 - 34 ) = 264 - 224 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow z = \frac{264 - 224 }{39 - 34 }
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow z = \frac{\input[s3v1]{} }{\input[s3v2]{} }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow z = \frac{8 }{1 }
\]
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [7, 22], "text": "Four numbers are proportional when $a:b::c:d$, thus, using this result we get \frac{7 + z }{12 + z } = \frac{22 + z }{32 + z }"}, {"data": [39, 34], "text": " Upon cross- multiplication and further simplification we get \[
	z = \frac{264 - 224 }{39 - 34 }
\]"}, {"data": [40, 5], "text": "Further simplification will give us the result as z $= \frac{8 }{1 }$ "}]
